results.title: Responding to change
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Penny Hendy describes her upbringing, her marriage as a “townie” to a “farmer” and her involvement with some 23 rural community organisations. As the women in her family before, Penny recognises the need to be resourceful, creative and flexible in response to change. Penny’s contribution to, and involvement with the Women in Grains has played a major role in her own life as well as the women she has mentored. Penny currently holds several high positions on various boards and continues to be a force within the rural community.

group.title: Against the grain: digital storytelling project

results.title: Respondent and operant behaviour (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Defines respondent and operant behaviour and shows laboratory experiments with mice, pigeons etc. illustrating biological and non- biological reinforcers and conditioning. Dogs and children demonstrate learned responses. Narrated by Jack K. Burton.

results.title: Respiratory tract infection in children's wards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Prevention of Cross Infection”.
Illustrates how cross infection by contact, droplet and dust borne methods may be prevented by isolation, barrier nursing and other methods. Written and directed by Margaret Thomson.

results.title: Respiratory system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
The organs of the respiratory system; mechanics of ventilation and physics of diffusion between alveoli and capillaries; effect on respiratory system of varying needs for oxygen; function of respiratory system in providing needed oxygen and eliminating carbon dioxide.

results.title: Respiratory and cardiac arrest
results.brief_description: Deals in detail with methods of resuscitation after heart failure during anaesthesia. It is treated in three parts: apparatus, respiratory obstruction, and cardiac arrest.

results.title: Respiration in man
results.brief_description: Living tissue and various instruments, techniques and experiments are used to illustrate the structure of the lungs. Movements of alveoli and blood in the vessels, gas concentration relationship, transport of 02 and C02, aortic and carotid bodies, and the function of carotid bodies are also shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Respecting differences (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Government and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that migrant children have in adjusting to Australian schools and culture, especially non-English speaking children. Recently the New South Wales Government has given funds to support the teaching of ethnic languages in many state schools which helps facilitate adjustment to Australian life.
